metadata.name: ESXi VM List Discovery Via ESXCLI
metadata.comment: Detects execution of the "esxcli" command with the "vm" flag in order to retrieve information about the installed VMs.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/esxcli')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('vm process')) AND endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' list')))

output.summary: Detects execution of the "esxcli" command with the "vm" flag in order to retrieve information about the installed VMs.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administration activities References: https://www.crowdstrike.com/blog/hypervisor-jackpotting-ecrime-actors-increase-targeting-of-esxi-servers/, https://developer.broadcom.com/xapis/esxcli-command-reference/7.0.0/namespace/esxcli_vm.html, https://www.secuinfra.com/en/techtalk/hide-your-hypervisor-analysis-of-esxiargs-ransomware/, https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/22/e/new-linux-based-ransomware-cheerscrypt-targets-exsi-devices.html
